title: Provincial Nominee Program (PNP)
subTitle: Apply for Permanent Residence (P.R.) through Provincial Nominee Program (PNP).
description: Canada has ten (10) provinces and three (3) territories. The provinces are Alberta, British Columbia, Manitoba, New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Nova Scotia, Ontario, Prince Edward Island, Quebec, and Saskatchewan. The territories are Northwest Territories, Nunavut, and Yukon.Each province and territories have their immigration streams also known as provincial nominee program (PNP) where they have own set of rules and requirements for a skilled worker. Most of the province has a link to federal skilled express entry and they can choose to nominate people from the pool.Immigration consultant has better visibility over the PNP and can suggest a program that suits your immigration needs.Please contact us out for one-one consultation.
